intro: Hedeoma polygalifolia, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, blue-gray foliage and delicate, mist-like blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers appear in clusters at the ends of stems. Hedeoma polygalifolia is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
